description: Participant's cohort assignment for the acoustic task, recorded as a categorical label (e.g., "Cohort A", "Cohort B", "pilot").
Total length of the acoustic task recording, measured in seconds.
Alphanumeric identifier for the specific acoustic task performed during the session (e.g., sustained vowel phonation, read passage, sentence repetition).
Short descriptive name of the acoustic task performed during the recording (e.g., "sustained vowel," "reading passage," "spontaneous speech," or "diadochokinetic syllables").
Unique alphanumeric identifier for the participant session/visit during which the acoustic task was recorded, used to link recordings and data from the same session.
Indicates the completion status of the participant's acoustic task, with typical responses such as completed, in progress, not started, or failed.
Total time, in seconds, taken by the participant to complete the adult ADHD questionnaire.
Unique session identifier for the adult ADHD visit, recorded as an alphanumeric code used to link data collected during the same study session.
How often the participant avoids or delays starting tasks that require a lot of thought, reported on a frequency scale (e.g., never to very often).
Self-reported frequency of making careless mistakes when working on boring or difficult projects, recorded on a frequency scale (e.g., Never to Very Often).
Self-reported frequency of having difficulty sustaining attention when performing boring or repetitive tasks, recorded on a categorical frequency scale (e.g., Never to Very Often).

Self-reported frequency of having difficulty concentrating on what others say to you even when they are speaking directly, recorded on a frequency scale (e.g., never, rarely, sometimes, often, very often).
Self-reported frequency of difficulty unwinding and relaxing when you have time to yourself, recorded on a frequency scale (e.g., never to very often).
Self-reported frequency of having difficulty waiting your turn in situations that require turn-taking, typically recorded on a frequency scale (e.g., never to very often).
Self-reported frequency of becoming distracted by surrounding activity or noise, rated on a frequency scale (e.g., "never" to "very often").
How often the person fidgets or squirms with their hands or feet when required to sit for a long time, rated on a frequency scale (e.g., Never → Very Often).
Self-reported frequency of finishing other people's sentences during conversation, typically recorded on a Likert frequency scale (e.g., never to very often).
Self-reported frequency of interrupting others when they are busy, recorded on a categorical frequency scale (e.g., never, rarely/sometimes, often).
Frequency of misplacing or having difficulty finding items at home or at work, recorded on a frequency scale (e.g., never, rarely, sometimes, often, very often).
Self-reported frequency of feeling overly active and compelled to do things as if driven by a motor, rated on a frequency scale (e.g., Never, Rarely, Sometimes, Often, Very Often).
Frequency of leaving one’s seat during meetings or other situations when remaining seated is expected, reported on a Likert frequency scale (e.g., never to very often).
Self-reported frequency of having problems remembering appointments or obligations, recorded on a categorical frequency scale (e.g., never to very often).
Self-reported frequency of feeling restless or fidgety, recorded on a categorical scale (e.g., never, rarely, sometimes, often, very often).
Self-reported frequency of talking too much in social situations, recorded on a Likert-style scale (e.g., Never, Rarely, Sometimes, Often, Very Often).

Self-reported frequency of having difficulty getting things in order when completing tasks that require organization, recorded on a frequency scale (e.g., Never, Rarely, Sometimes, Often, Very Often).
Frequency of difficulty finishing the final details of a project after the challenging parts are completed, recorded on a frequency scale (e.g., never to very often).
Indicates whether the participant has audible stridor—a high‑pitched, noisy breathing sound—either at rest or while talking; responses: Yes or No.
Indicates whether the patient has stridor and, if present, its timing/type (e.g., inspiratory, expiratory, or biphasic).
Subjective rating by the examiner of stridor severity (e.g., none, mild, moderate, or severe).
Specific subtype of the patient's airway stenosis diagnosis (for example: idiopathic, traumatic, iatrogenic, or congenital).
Aziz classification grade indicating the severity of supraglottic stenosis, recorded as an ordinal grade (severity level).
Indicates whether the patient's supraglottic airway stenosis is classified as Grade 4 according to the Aziz classification (response: Yes/No).
Aziz Classification grade for supraglottic stenosis, recorded as an ordinal rating (e.g., Grade I–IV) where higher grades indicate more severe airway narrowing.
Cohen classification (Type I–IV) of anterior glottic web severity, indicating the extent of anterior vocal fold fusion.
Degree of airway stenosis categorized by the Bogdasarian classification (stages I–IV, with higher stages indicating greater severity).
Bogdasarian grade (I–IV) indicating the categorical severity of airway stenosis, with higher grades representing greater narrowing of the airway.

Subtype of airway diagnosis for patients with bilateral vocal fold immobility (BVFI) or glottic stenosis, recorded as a categorical value indicating BVFI or the specific glottic stenosis subtype (e.g., anterior, posterior, concentric, other/unspecified).
Free-text field for specifying any other airway stenosis diagnosis not covered by the listed options.
Cohen classification of an anterior glottic web (Type I–IV), recorded as Cohen I, II, III, or IV to indicate increasing web size and vocal fold involvement.
Clinician’s subjective estimate of airway stenosis expressed as percent narrowing of the lumen, recorded as a number from 0 to 100%.

Degree of subglottic airway narrowing using the Myer–Cotton classification: Grade I (0–50% obstruction), Grade II (51–70% obstruction), Grade III (71–99% obstruction), and Grade IV (complete/100% obstruction).
Ordinal Myer‑Cotton grade indicating percent airway (typically subglottic) obstruction: Grade I = 0–50% obstruction, Grade II = 51–70%, Grade III = 71–99%, Grade IV = 100% (no detectable lumen).
Description of the anatomical level(s) of airway stenosis and their severity, reported as percent luminal narrowing or a clinical grade/scale (e.g., grade 1–4).
Clinician's subjective overall classification of airway stenosis severity as a categorical rating (e.g., none, mild, moderate, severe).
Underlying cause of the airway stenosis, specified as the primary etiology (e.g., congenital, iatrogenic, traumatic, infectious, autoimmune, neoplastic, or idiopathic).

Indicates whether the cause of the airway stenosis is an autoimmune or granulomatous disease (e.g., granulomatosis with polyangiitis, sarcoidosis), reported as present/absent or by the specific diagnosis.
Free-text field to specify any other cause (etiology) of airway stenosis that is not included in the listed response options.
Indicates whether the participant has airway stenosis confirmed by laryngoscopy, bronchoscopy, or CT imaging (Yes/No).
Name or role of the clinician or diagnostic method that confirmed the diagnosis as GSD (e.g., surgeon, pulmonologist, or pathology report).
Indicates whether the participant underwent pulmonary function testing (e.g., spirometry, lung volumes, diffusion capacity) within the past 3 months; responses: yes or no.
Scanned or digital pulmonary function test (PFT) report file (e.g., PDF, TIFF, JPEG) documenting the participant's PFT results relevant to the airway stenosis diagnosis.

Treatment(s) the participant has received for their airway stenosis (e.g., surgical resection, dilation/bronchoplasty, stent placement, tracheostomy, laser therapy, corticosteroids or other medications, or none).

Which in‑office (awake) treatment option(s) were performed for the airway stenosis (one or more may be selected), e.g., steroid injection, endoscopic dilation, topical medication, voice therapy, or observation.
Type(s) of surgical treatment received for the airway diagnosis, recorded as the procedure(s) performed (e.g., tracheostomy, dilation, laryngotracheoplasty, cricotracheal resection).
Free-text description specifying any other surgery performed as treatment for airway stenosis that is not covered by the predefined options.
Total ADAS‑Cog score (points) assessing global cognitive impairment in Alzheimer's disease, with higher scores indicating greater dysfunction (standard 11‑item range 0–70).
Total Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score (integer 0–30) measuring global cognitive function, with higher scores indicating better cognitive performance.

Total score on the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA), reported in points from 0–30, with higher scores indicating better cognitive function and lower scores suggesting possible mild cognitive impairment or dementia.
Name any other cognitive assessment tool used to evaluate the participant’s cognition (free-text entry specifying the test name(s)).
Participant's numeric score (in points) on any additional cognitive assessment tool administered to the participant.
Total score on the Rowland Universal Dementia Assessment Scale (RUDAS), range 0–30, with higher values indicating better cognitive performance.
Whether other causes of cognitive or functional changes (including alternative dementia subtypes) have been excluded, recorded as Yes/No.
Current stage/severity of the participant’s cognitive impairment or dementia, recorded categorically (e.g., no impairment, mild cognitive impairment [MCI], or mild/moderate/severe dementia).

Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) staging subcategory indicating dementia severity, recorded as numeric categories: 0 = no dementia, 0.5 = questionable/mild cognitive impairment, 1 = mild dementia, 2 = moderate dementia, 3 = severe dementia.
Participant's diagnosed cognitive disease type (e.g., Alzheimer's disease, dementia, mild cognitive impairment [MCI], or cognitively normal).
Free-text field for specifying the participant's other diagnosis when "other" was selected for Alzheimer's disease / dementia / mild cognitive impairment.
Suspected or confirmed cause of the participant’s dementia or mild cognitive impairment (e.g., Alzheimer’s disease, vascular, Lewy body, frontotemporal, mixed, or unknown).

Lists genetic factors related to the participant's Alzheimer’s/dementia/MCI etiology (e.g., APOE ε4 carrier status, known pathogenic mutations like APP/PSEN1/PSEN2, familial inheritance, "none", or "unknown").

Free-text field for specifying any genetic factor(s) not listed among the provided etiology options when "Other genetic factors" was selected for the participant's Alzheimer's disease/dementia/mild cognitive impairment.
Free-text field to specify an alternative etiology for Alzheimer’s disease, dementia, or mild cognitive impairment when “other” was selected.

Free-text field to specify which other medical condition(s) contribute to the participant’s Alzheimer’s disease, dementia, or mild cognitive impairment etiology (used when "other medical conditions" was selected).

Categorical field indicating whether the participant has a diagnosis of Major Neurocognitive Disorder (Alzheimer’s type), Mild Cognitive Impairment, another form of dementia, or no/unknown cognitive disorder (e.g., Alzheimer’s, MCI, other dementia, none/unknown).

Free-text clinical history describing the participant’s cognitive symptoms, onset and course, comorbidities, treatments, and other relevant medical details related to Alzheimer’s disease, dementia, mild cognitive impairment, or subjective cognitive decline.
Documents whether standardized cognitive testing was administered and, if so, lists the test name(s) and corresponding scores (e.g., MMSE or MoCA total points).

Methods used to confirm the diagnosis, with options such as clinical assessment, neuropsychological testing, brain imaging (MRI/CT), PET or CSF biomarkers, genetic testing, and review of medical records or informant report.
If "Other" was chosen for how the Alzheimer's disease/dementia/mild cognitive impairment diagnosis was confirmed, provide a brief free-text description of the alternative confirmation method.

Total score from a functional inventory assessing everyday task performance and functional impairment in individuals with Alzheimer's disease or mild cognitive impairment, recorded as item-level ratings and/or a numeric summary (higher scores indicate greater impairment).

Free-text description of any other investigations performed (e.g., additional laboratory tests, imaging studies, biomarker assays, or neuropsychological assessments), including relevant details such as test type, date, and results.

Indicates whether the participant has ever received treatment (e.g., medications, cognitive or behavioral therapies, or other interventions) for Alzheimer’s disease, mild cognitive impairment, or other dementia, recorded as Yes/No.
Indicates whether the participant has received treatment for Alzheimer's disease, dementia, or mild cognitive impairment (response: Yes/No).
Names of medications the participant is taking for Alzheimer’s disease, dementia, or mild cognitive impairment (entered as a free-text list; include dose and frequency when available).
Free-text entry for naming any other medication(s) obtained for treating Alzheimer's disease, dementia, or mild cognitive impairment when "Other" was selected.

Names any non-pharmacological (non-drug) interventions the participant has received for cognitive impairment or dementia (for example, cognitive training, physical/occupational therapy, psychotherapy, speech therapy, exercise programs, or caregiver/caregiver-education support).
Open-text field for specifying other treatment(s) obtained for Alzheimer’s disease, dementia, or mild cognitive impairment when "Other" was selected.

Free-text description of the participant's ALS clinical features and symptoms, including onset and distribution (e.g., limb vs. bulbar), speech/swallowing difficulties, respiratory involvement, and progression rate.
Clinical subtype of the participant’s ALS (e.g., bulbar-onset, limb-onset, respiratory-onset, flail-limb, primary lateral sclerosis, progressive muscular atrophy, or other/unspecified).
If the participant has familial ALS, name the known causative genetic mutation (e.g., SOD1, C9orf72, TARDBP), entered as free-text.

Brief summary of the participant’s current ALS stage and recent progression, e.g., stage (early/moderate/advanced), time since symptom onset (months), affected regions (bulbar vs limb), and whether symptoms are stable, improving, or worsening.
Suspected or confirmed etiology of the participant’s ALS, e.g., sporadic, familial/genetic (specific ALS gene if known), environmental/other, or unknown.

Free-text description of any specific environmental exposures or factors thought to contribute to the participant’s ALS (e.g., occupational toxin or pesticide exposure, smoking, head injury, or other relevant exposures).

Indicates whether genetic factors are implicated in the participant’s ALS, with response options for presence/absence and space to list specific pathogenic genes or variants (e.g., C9orf72, SOD1) or relevant family history.
Free-text field to specify any other genetic factors (for example, gene names or specific variants) associated with ALS when "Other genetic factors" was selected.
Indicates whether the participant has been diagnosed with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS), recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant has progressive motor impairment, documented by history or repeated clinical assessments, that began after a period of normal motor function (yes/no).

Whether the participant meets ALS diagnostic criterion 2 — either upper and lower motor neuron (UMN and LMN) signs in at least one body region (both in the same region if only one region is involved) or LMN signs in at least two body regions — recorded as Yes/No.
Indicates whether diagnostic investigations have ruled out alternative disease processes (response: Yes/No).

Specifies which methods were used to confirm the ALS diagnosis (e.g., clinical neurological exam, electromyography/nerve conduction studies, genetic testing, neuroimaging, autopsy), with multiple selections allowed.

Summary of electromyography (EMG) and nerve conduction study (NCS) findings indicating whether the tests were performed and their result (e.g., normal, abnormal, not performed) with key features noted such as denervation, axonal loss, or demyelination.

Indicates whether ALS-related genetic testing was performed and, if applicable, lists the tested gene(s) and their results (e.g., pathogenic or likely pathogenic variant, variant of uncertain significance, or negative).

If performed, the lumbar puncture findings — e.g., CSF opening pressure (cm H2O), cell count (cells/µL), protein and glucose (mg/dL), presence of oligoclonal bands, and microbiology results — as observed.

Indicates whether a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) exam of the brain and spinal cord was performed and captures associated findings (typically recorded as yes/no for exam performed plus descriptive text such as normal or abnormal).
Free-text description of any additional diagnostic tests used to evaluate or confirm ALS that are not captured by the listed options.
Total Revised ALS Functional Rating Scale (ALSFRS‑R) score in points (0–48), with higher scores indicating better functional ability.
Forced vital capacity expressed as the percent of the predicted value (%) for the participant, if measured.
Free-text field to specify any additional neurological assessment not listed elsewhere, including the assessment type and relevant findings or notes.

Indicates whether the participant has received any treatments or interventions for ALS (e.g., medications like riluzole or edaravone, physical/speech therapy, feeding tube, or ventilatory support), recorded as Yes/No with option to specify details.
Binary indicator of whether the participant is receiving treatment or management for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (response options: "Yes" or "No").
Names of the participant's current medications used to treat or manage ALS, including dose and frequency when available.
Free-text field to specify any other ALS medication(s) taken for treatment or management when "Other" was selected.
Whether the participant receives supportive care for ALS (e.g., palliative care, assistive devices, nutritional or respiratory support); response: yes/no.
Free-text description of any other supportive care or management approaches for ALS provided when "Other" was selected.
Open-ended text describing the participant’s psychotherapy history, including relevant details such as treatment dates, reasons for seeking therapy, and issues addressed.
Date or approximate time of the participant's most recent anxious episode (a period of feeling anxious more days than not for at least two weeks), reported as a date or month/year.
Whether the participant has ever been prescribed medication for mental or emotional problems (e.g., antidepressants, anxiolytics, antipsychotics, mood stabilizers); responses: Yes/No.
Whether the participant has ever seen a mental health professional (e.g., social worker, psychiatrist) for talk therapy, typically recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant has ever been medically diagnosed with an anxiety disorder (response: Yes/No).
Indicates whether a clinician has diagnosed the participant with an anxiety disorder (response: Yes or No).
Indicates whether a benign laryngeal lesion was confirmed by laryngoscopy or stroboscopy (response: Yes/No).
Degree of breathiness in the participant’s voice, recorded as a categorical severity rating (e.g., none, mild, moderate, severe).
Degree of breathiness in the participant's voice, recorded as a severity rating (e.g., none, mild, moderate, or severe).
Degree of loudness, recorded as a severity rating (for example none/mild/moderate/severe or an equivalent numeric scale).
Perceived loudness (intensity) of the symptom as reported by the participant, recorded as a numeric unitless rating with higher values indicating greater loudness.
Describes the nature of any loudness abnormality in the voice, e.g., increased (too loud), decreased (soft), variable/fluctuating, or inconsistent.
Legend explaining codes for degree of benign lesion findings: C = Consistent, I = Intermittent, MI = Mildly Deviant, MO = Moderately Deviant, SE = Severely Deviant.
Overall severity of the benign lesion(s) in the left eye (OS) at baseline, recorded on the study’s categorical severity scale (e.g., none, mild, moderate, severe).
Overall severity of the benign lesion(s) in the left eye, recorded as a categorical rating (e.g., none, mild, moderate, severe).
Participant's voice pitch, recorded either as a perceptual category (e.g., high, normal, low) or as a measured fundamental frequency in Hertz (Hz).
Perceived or measured voice pitch for the participant, recorded as a degree (e.g., low/normal/high) or, when available, as a frequency value in hertz (Hz).
Indicates the nature of any pitch abnormality in the participant’s voice, recorded categorically (e.g., high, low, monotone, variable).
Degree of surface roughness of the benign lesion, recorded as a clinical rating (for example none/mild/moderate/severe or on a numeric scale).
Observed roughness severity, recorded as an ordinal/categorical rating (e.g., none, mild, moderate, or severe).
Indicates whether a strain was diagnosed and, if present, its severity (e.g., none, mild, moderate, severe).
Perceived degree of vocal strain during phonation, recorded as a categorical rating (e.g., none, mild, moderate, or severe).
Overall degree of dysphonia measured using the CAPE‑V visual-analog scale (0–100, with higher scores indicating greater severity).
Clinician-recorded diagnosis of the benign lesion (e.g., cyst, lipoma, hemangioma, nevus, papilloma, adenoma, or other specified benign lesion).
Anatomical location(s) of the lesion(s) on the body, recorded as body site(s) (e.g., left forearm, right cheek, scalp); multiple sites may be listed.
Free-text field to specify any other benign lesion diagnosis not covered by the listed response options.
Primary cause or origin of the benign lesion, recorded categorically (e.g., congenital, traumatic, inflammatory, infectious, neoplastic, or unknown).
Free-text field to specify the etiology of the benign lesion when "Other" is selected.
Indicates whether the participant has undergone any treatment for this condition (response options: Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant underwent laryngeal microsurgery to treat the benign lesion (response: Yes/No).
Free-text description of any other treatment received at baseline for benign lesions that is not captured by the predefined response options.

Which treatments the participant received for the benign lesion diagnosis at baseline, allowing multiple selections (e.g., observation/monitoring, medication, topical therapy, surgery, radiation, other, or none).
Brief free-text description of the participant's psychotherapy history (e.g., dates or duration of treatment and reasons for seeking therapy).
Indicates whether the participant was diagnosed with Bipolar I, Bipolar II, or another/unspecified form of bipolar disorder (response options: Bipolar I; Bipolar II; Other/Unspecified).
Indicates whether the participant has ever received a clinical diagnosis of Bipolar Disorder (response: Yes or No).
Indicates whether the participant has been diagnosed with Bipolar I disorder, Bipolar II disorder, both, or neither, with responses specifying which subtype(s) apply.
Free-text entry to specify any other bipolar-related diagnosis not listed among the previous response options.
Indicates whether the participant has ever experienced hallucinations (seeing or hearing things others do not); responses: yes/no.

Indicates whether the participant has ever had a manic episode (Yes/No), defined as a period of abnormally elevated, expansive, or irritable mood with increased goal-directed activity or energy lasting ≥1 week and present most of the day, nearly every day, while not under the influence of substances.

Date or approximate timing of the participant’s most recent depressive episode (period of feeling down most days for at least two weeks), reported as a date or an approximate time period (e.g., month/year or years ago).
Participant-reported timing of their most recent manic episode, recorded as a date or a time interval (for example, months or years ago).
Estimated number of lifetime depressive episodes—periods of feeling down and depressed more days than not for at least two weeks—reported as an approximate numeric count.
Approximate lifetime count of manic episodes experienced by the participant, entered as a numeric value (e.g., 0 for none).
Whether the participant has ever been prescribed medication for mental or emotional problems (yes/no), for example antidepressants, anxiolytics, antipsychotics, or mood stabilizers.
Whether the participant has a diagnosis or history of acid reflux (e.g., heartburn, GERD), recorded as Yes/No.
Indicates whether the participant has a current or past diagnosis/history of attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), typically recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Participant's age in years when they first started using nicotine-containing products (numeric, reported in years).
Participant's age in years when they stopped using nicotine products (numeric value, reported in years).
Indicates whether the participant has a history of airway stenosis (e.g., glottal, subglottal, tracheal), typically recorded as a yes/no response.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of airway surgery or reconstruction below the vocal folds (e.g., tracheal reconstruction, balloon dilation), recorded as yes/no.
Number of standard alcoholic drinks typically consumed on a drinking day, where one drink is 12 oz (330 mL) beer, 5 oz (150 mL) wine, or 1.5 oz (45 mL) spirits.
Frequency of having six or more alcoholic drinks on a single occasion in the past year, recorded categorically (e.g., never, less than monthly, monthly, weekly, or daily/almost daily).
Participant-reported frequency of consuming at least one alcoholic drink, recorded as categorical options (e.g., "Never", "Monthly or less", "2–4 times/month", "2–3 times/week", "4+ times/week").
Indicates whether the participant has a diagnosed alcohol or other substance use disorder (e.g., alcohol, opioids, stimulants), typically recorded as Yes/No.
Indicates whether the participant consumed any alcohol today (responses: Yes or No).
Indicates whether the participant drinks alcoholic beverages (Yes/No), with "alcohol" defined to include beer, wine, shots of liquor, and cocktails containing liquor.
Indicates whether the participant uses allergy medications (antihistamines), typically recorded as yes/no and, if yes, the specific medication(s) and any dose or frequency details.

Indicates whether the participant took analgesic (pain-relief) medication, typically recorded as a yes/no flag and/or the medication name and may include dose (e.g., mg) and timing relative to the assessment.
Indicates whether the participant currently or previously used androgenic (anabolic) steroids (Yes/No), with optional details about compound, dose (e.g., mg), route, and duration when available.
Indicates whether the participant is currently taking anti-anxiety medication (yes/no); when applicable, record medication name, dose, and frequency.
Indicates whether the participant used antibiotics, typically recorded as Yes/No and may include timing (date) or duration (days) of use.

Indicates current use of anticholinergic medications (drugs that block acetylcholine receptors), typically recorded as yes/no and, when available, with specific medication names and dosages (e.g., oxybutynin 5 mg).
Indicates whether the participant is currently taking antidepressant medication (Yes/No); if yes, list medication name(s), dosage(s) (e.g., mg) and duration of use.
Indicates whether the participant is currently taking antiepileptic (anti-seizure) medication; record as yes/no and, if yes, list medication names and dosages (e.g., mg/day).
Indicates whether the participant has a history of an anxiety disorder (e.g., generalized or social anxiety disorder), recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant is experiencing anxiety or nervousness at the time of assessment (recorded as Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant currently has any dental condition (e.g., tooth loss, dentures, retainer, braces); responses recorded as Yes or No.
Free-text field where the participant lists any current or past dental condition(s) (e.g., cavities/tooth decay, periodontal/gum disease, tooth loss, dentures).
Indicates whether the participant currently has any infectious disease, recorded as "Yes" or "No."
Free-text field for listing any other infectious disease(s) the participant has (e.g., tuberculosis, HIV, hepatitis), entered as text and allowing multiple conditions (e.g., comma-separated).
Indicates whether the participant has apraxia of speech, a motor-planning speech disorder, recorded as presence/absence or with a clinician-rated severity level.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of a diagnosed autism spectrum disorder (ASD), recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of asthma (a chronic lung condition), recorded as yes/no (or unknown).

Indicates whether the participant has clinically observed ataxia—impaired coordination of voluntary movements (e.g., gait, limb, or speech)—typically recorded as present/absent or by a severity rating.
Indicates whether the participant has a diagnosis or history of atrial fibrillation, recorded as Yes or No.
Average number of times the item was used per day, entered as a numeric count (uses/day).
Self-reported average number of times per day the participant used nicotine across the entire period they used nicotine (measured in times/day).
Indicates whether the participant has a history or diagnosis of bipolar disorder (e.g., bipolar I or II); responses typically recorded as yes, no, or unknown.
Whether the participant is currently taking antihypertensive (blood pressure‑lowering) medications; medication names and dosages are recorded when applicable.
Whether the participant has received botulinum toxin (Botox) injections to treat laryngeal dystonia (recorded as yes/no; timing or frequency may also be provided if available).
Whether the participant has a history of borderline personality disorder (BPD), recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant has ever been diagnosed with brain cancer (response options: yes / no / unknown).
Indicates whether the participant has a current or prior diagnosis of a brain tumor (response options: yes / no / unknown).
Indicates whether the participant has a diagnosis of bronchiectasis, a chronic lung condition causing permanent airway dilation (response options: Yes / No / Unknown).
Indicates whether the participant uses CPAP (continuous positive airway pressure) therapy for sleep-disordered breathing, recorded as a yes/no response.
Number of servings of caffeinated products typically consumed per day, where one serving = 8 oz (240 mL) of coffee, tea, or energy drink; 1 oz (30 mL) of espresso; or 12 oz (360 mL) of soda.
Number of servings of caffeinated products consumed today, recorded as an integer count in servings (0 = none).
Indicates whether the participant has ever received chemotherapy treatment (current or prior), typically recorded as Yes/No (or Unknown).
Whether the participant has ever undergone chest surgery (e.g., bronchoscopy or thoracic surgery); typically recorded as yes/no, with optional fields for procedure type and date.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of chest wall trauma (e.g., rib fracture, flail chest, or significant chest contusion); recorded as Yes/No.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of chronic cough (persistent cough, commonly defined as lasting longer than 8 weeks), recorded as yes/no.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of chronic ear infections (persistent or recurrent middle ear infections), typically recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of chronic ear surgery (e.g., mastoid surgery), recorded as Yes or No.
Whether the participant has a clinical diagnosis of chronic kidney disease (CKD), typically recorded as "Yes" or "No" (with "Unknown" or "Prefer not to answer" where applicable).
Indicates whether the participant has a clinical diagnosis of chronic pericarditis, recorded as yes, no, or unknown.
Checkbox field listing clinician-diagnosed circulatory (cardiovascular) conditions that may affect the participant’s voice, with multiple selections allowed.

Indicates whether the participant has a congenital cleft lip, recorded as a categorical response (Yes / No / Unknown) and, if available, may include laterality (left/right/bilateral) or repair status.
Indicates whether the participant has a cleft palate (a congenital opening or split in the roof of the mouth), typically recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Indicates whether the participant uses or has used club drugs (e.g., MDMA/ecstasy), typically recorded as a yes/no response or, if available, as frequency or timeframe of use.
Indicates whether the participant uses or has used cocaine (including crack).
Indicates whether the participant has a cochlear implant (typically recorded as No or Yes; if Yes, note side — left, right, or bilateral — and device/model if available).
Date and time when the confounders questionnaire was completed by the participant, recorded as an ISO 8601 timestamp (e.g., 2023-05-15T14:30:00Z).
Total time, in seconds, taken by the participant to complete the confounders questionnaire.
Unique alphanumeric identifier for the participant's recording session or visit used to link data from the same session.
Timestamp indicating when the confounders questionnaire was started, recorded as an ISO 8601 datetime (date and time, typically including timezone).
Presence of confusion (e.g., disorientation or impaired awareness) at the time of assessment, recorded as present/absent (yes/no).
Whether the participant has a current or past clinical diagnosis of congestive heart failure (responses typically: yes / no / unknown).

Indicates whether the participant currently uses any form of contraceptive/birth control and, if so, the method type (e.g., oral contraceptives, IUD, implant, injection, barrier methods, sterilization, or none).
Indicates whether the participant has a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.

Indicates whether the participant has undergone a laryngeal surgical procedure (e.g., cordotomy, arytenoidectomy, arytenoid tie-back), typically recorded as yes/no and may include date or laterality if available.
Indicates whether the participant has been diagnosed with coronary heart disease (coronary artery disease/angina), recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Indicates whether the participant was coughing or clearing their throat during the recording (yes/no).
Whether the participant had COVID-19 that affected their lungs (response options: Yes, No, Unknown).
Indicates whether the participant self-reported a confirmed positive COVID-19 test within the past 10 days (Yes/No).

Indicates whether the participant has a history of craniofacial trauma (significant injury to the face, skull, or jaw); response typically recorded as yes/no, with optional details on type and date if available.
Indicates whether the participant is currently in recovery from alcohol use (yes/no).
Self-reported indication of whether the participant is currently in recovery from substance use (typically recorded as Yes/No).
Indicates current self-reported use of nicotine products (e.g., cigarettes, e-cigarettes, gum, patches), with responses "every day", "some days", or "not at all".
Self-reported current obesity status, indicating whether the participant is currently considered obese (expected responses: Yes or No).
Indicates whether the participant currently has a diagnosis of diabetes (response recorded as "Yes" or "No").
Indicates whether the participant is pregnant and, if so, which trimester they are in (Not pregnant; First, Second, or Third trimester; or Unknown).
Self-reported yes/no indication of whether everyday environmental pollution (e.g., smog, smoke, dust) significantly affects the participant’s breathing or voice.
Indicates whether the participant recently used decongestant medications (e.g., nasal sprays or oral decongestants), typically recorded as yes/no and optionally specifying type and timing of use.
Indicates whether the participant has an implanted deep brain stimulator (DBS), recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Indicates whether the participant has a current or past diagnosis of depression (major depressive disorder), recorded as Yes/No.
Participant-reported type of diabetes (e.g., Type 1, Type 2, gestational, or other).
Whether the participant is currently taking diuretic medications (Yes/No); if available, include medication name, dose, and frequency.
Indicates whether the participant experiences dizziness (lightheadedness or balance disturbance), recorded as Yes or No.
Number of alcoholic drinks consumed today (count of standard drinks; enter 0 if none).
Indicates whether the participant has dysarthria—a motor speech disorder causing slurred, slow, or effortful speech—typically recorded as Yes/No/Unknown.
Indicates whether the participant has ever been diagnosed with cancer of the ear (typically recorded as Yes/No, with optional Unknown or Prefer not to answer responses).
Whether the participant currently has ear (tympanostomy) tubes inserted, typically recorded as yes/no and, if available, by side (left/right/bilateral).

Indicates whether the participant has a current or past eating disorder (e.g., anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge-eating disorder), typically recorded as Yes/No with an optional field to specify the disorder type.
Frequency of marijuana edibles used in the past three months, recorded as categorical frequency responses (e.g., never, less than monthly, monthly, weekly, daily/almost daily).
Indicates whether the participant has a clinical diagnosis of emphysema, typically recorded as present/absent (yes/no) or unknown.
Whether the participant has a clinical diagnosis of epilepsy (response options: yes / no / unknown).
Indicates whether the participant has ever been diagnosed with esophageal cancer (response options: Yes, No, or Unknown/Not reported).
Whether the participant has undergone esophageal dilation (a medical procedure to widen a narrowed esophagus), typically recorded as Yes/No and may include date or number of procedures if available.
Indicates whether the participant has ever (lifetime) attended rehabilitation or counseling specifically for heavy alcohol use, typically recorded as Yes/No.
Which nicotine/tobacco products the participant has ever used (lifetime), with multiple selections allowed (e.g., cigarettes, e-cigarettes/vapes, cigars, hookah, smokeless tobacco, other, or none).

Free-text description of which nicotine products the participant has ever used (for example, cigarettes, e-cigarettes/vapes, cigars, smokeless tobacco/chewing tobacco, nicotine pouches, or nicotine replacement products).

Indicates whether the participant is currently or recently enrolled in a clinical trial or receiving an experimental treatment (typically recorded as "yes"/"no", with an optional trial name or identifier).
Free-text description of any experimental treatment (e.g., clinical trial medication or intervention) the participant is currently receiving.
Free-text description of any experimental treatment (e.g., clinical trial drug, device, or other intervention) the participant received in the past.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of glottic insufficiency (including presbyphonia), recorded as yes/no/unknown.
Indicates whether the participant has used hallucinogenic drugs (e.g., LSD), recorded as a yes/no response or with frequency/count if provided.
Indicates whether the participant reports having headaches or migraines (Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant has hearing loss, recorded as categorical values such as "Yes" or "No" (with possible additional categories for severity or "Unknown" if available).
Participant height as a numeric value in centimeters (cm); indicate the unit if a different unit (e.g., meters or inches) was used.
Indicates whether the participant uses or has used heroin or other opioids (including synthetic opioids such as fentanyl); responses are typically Yes/No.

Indicates whether the participant is currently taking hormone medications (e.g., contraceptives or hormone replacement such as estrogen, progesterone, or testosterone), typically recorded as Yes/No and, if yes, the specific type and dose (units such as mg or µg).
Number of hours per day the participant spends using a loud voice or being in noisy environments that require raising their voice (hours/day).
Indicates whether the participant is taking hormonal replacement therapy (HRT) — e.g., estrogen, progesterone, or combined formulations — typically recorded as a yes/no response.
Typical daily number of small (8 oz / 230 mL) cups of water the participant drinks.
Number of small cups of water consumed today, where one small cup = 8 oz (≈230 mL), recorded as an integer count (0 if none).
Whether the participant is currently taking immunosuppressive medications (yes/no); if yes, record medication names and, when available, dose and start date.
Indicates whether the participant is receiving or has previously received immunotherapy (for example, immune checkpoint inhibitors or CAR‑T therapy), recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Indicates whether the participant uses or has used inhalants or solvents (e.g., glue), recorded as a yes/no response.
Whether the participant currently uses inhaled corticosteroid medications (e.g., fluticasone, budesonide), typically recorded as yes/no, with dose and frequency noted if available.
Indicates whether the participant has ever received an injection or implant to the vocal folds (recorded as yes/no).
Indicates whether the participant currently uses insulin medication for diabetes management (response: Yes/No); if a dose is recorded it is reported in international units (IU) per day.
Indicates whether the participant has a current or past diagnosis of interstitial lung disease (e.g., sarcoidosis or pulmonary fibrosis); expected values: yes / no.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of laryngeal cancer (e.g., affecting the vocal folds or epiglottis); responses: yes/no.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of laryngitis (inflammation of the voice box), typically recorded as Yes/No.
Indicates whether the participant has a history or current diagnosis of laryngospasm or irritable larynx (yes/no).
Indicates whether the participant has lesions of the vocal cords (e.g., nodules, polyps, papillomas), recorded as present or absent (yes/no) with an option for unknown or not assessed.
Indicates whether the participant has ever had a lobectomy (surgical removal of a lobe of an organ, commonly the lung), recorded as Yes/No/Unknown.
Indicates whether the participant has been diagnosed with lung cancer (response options: Yes, No, Unknown).
Participant-reported marijuana use, recorded as a categorical indicator (e.g., yes/no or current/past) and/or as frequency (e.g., times per week or per month).
Participant's current medications, recorded as medication names and, when available, dose (e.g., mg) and frequency, including prescription and over‑the‑counter agents.

Names of current or past medications used to treat cancer (e.g., chemotherapy agents, targeted/precision therapies, immunotherapies, hormonal therapies), entered as medication names or treatment types.
Names of medications used to treat lung-related conditions (e.g., inhalers, bronchodilators, corticosteroids), with dose and frequency when available.
Names of medications taken for neurological conditions recorded as free-text, including dose and timing details when provided.

Names of current or past psychiatric/psychological medications (e.g., antidepressants, antipsychotics, anxiolytics); include drug name and, when available, dosage (with units, e.g., mg) and start/stop dates.

Current menstrual cycle status, indicating phase or relevant conditions (examples: menstruating/period, follicular, ovulatory, luteal, not menstruating/postmenopausal, pregnant, or using hormonal contraception).
Indicates whether the participant currently has menstrual periods (yes/no), including both regular and irregular cycles.
Indicates whether the participant is not currently menstruating (binary: Yes/No, where “Yes” signifies the participant is not menstruating).
Indicates whether the participant has used methamphetamine (commonly called "speed"), recorded as a yes/no response.
Indicates whether the participant engages in mindfulness or meditation practices, and may include frequency (e.g., times per week) or typical session duration (minutes).
Indicates whether the participant has a diagnosis of multiple sclerosis, recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant is currently taking muscle relaxant medications (yes/no); if yes, the specific medication name and dose may also be recorded.
Indicates presence of muscle tension dysphonia — a voice disorder caused by excessive laryngeal muscle tension — recorded as a binary yes/no.
Indicates whether the participant has nasal congestion or obstruction (presence/absence), which can affect breathing and voice recordings.

Indicates current use of neuromodulatory medications or therapies (e.g., stimulants, antidepressants, antipsychotics, antiepileptics, deep brain stimulation, transcranial magnetic stimulation); responses should list specific agents or interventions and, when available, dose and frequency (e.g., drug name and mg/day).

Free-text description of any other non-surgical treatment received for an ear, nose, mouth, throat, or speech condition (e.g., medications, injections, or speech therapy), including treatment type and relevant details such as duration.

Open-text entry specifying any other non-surgical treatments currently being received for ear, nose, mouth, throat, or speech conditions (for example, medications, speech therapy, hearing aids, or assistive devices).
Whether the participant has ever had nose surgery (e.g., septoplasty, rhinoplasty); responses: Yes or No.

Indicates whether the participant is currently taking nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) (e.g., ibuprofen, naproxen); recorded as yes/no or with specific drug names and dose (mg) if provided.
The participant’s current average number of times they use the relevant product or behavior per day, recorded as a numeric count (uses/day).
Total number of years the participant has used nicotine-containing products, reported as a numeric value in years.
Indicates whether the participant has obesity, recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Indicates whether the participant has ever been diagnosed with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD); typical responses: yes, no, or unknown/missing.
Indicates whether the participant is currently taking opiate (opioid) medications (response: yes/no).
Indicates whether the participant has a current or past diagnosis of oral or oropharyngeal cancer (e.g., tongue, mouth, gum, tonsil); responses: Yes/No.
Indicates whether the participant is taking oral corticosteroid medication (e.g., prednisone), recorded as a yes/no response and, when available, reported dosage in milligrams and dosing frequency.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), recorded as present/absent (Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant has any other cancer diagnoses besides their primary cancer (Yes/No), with Yes typically accompanied by a specification of the cancer type.
Free-text entry listing any other current cancer diagnosis(es), including cancer type and anatomical site.
Free-text field for listing any other cancer(s) the participant has had in the past, specifying cancer type and site (list multiple cancers separated by commas).

Free-text description of any additional cancer treatments not captured elsewhere (e.g., surgery, chemotherapy, radiation, immunotherapy, targeted or hormonal therapy), including relevant details such as treatment type, dates, and duration.
Free-text description of any other cancer treatment(s) the participant received in the past (e.g., surgery, chemotherapy, radiation, immunotherapy, hormonal, or targeted therapies).
Whether the participant currently has any other condition affecting the ear, nose, or mouth (response: Yes/No; if Yes, details of the condition are provided).
Free-text entry where the participant specifies any additional ear, nose, or mouth condition(s) they have that are not captured by the other response options.
Indicates whether the participant currently has any other heart disease(s) (yes/no), with space to specify the type if applicable.
Free-text description of any other heart condition(s) the participant has (e.g., congenital heart defect, cardiomyopathy).

Names any additional hormone replacement therapies the participant is taking that are not captured elsewhere, entered as free-text specifying the hormone(s) and, if available, dose, route, and frequency.
Text field listing any additional hormone replacement therapies the participant currently takes, specified by type or medication name (e.g., estrogen, testosterone, progesterone).
Indicates whether the participant currently has any other lung condition (yes/no), with an option to specify the condition if yes.
Text response naming any other current lung condition(s) the participant has (e.g., COPD, pulmonary fibrosis, bronchiectasis).
Indicates whether the participant is currently receiving any additional treatment(s) for their lung condition(s) (response options: Yes or No).

Free-text entry describing any other treatments received for lung conditions, with examples such as pulmonary rehabilitation, supplemental oxygen, inhaled or systemic medications, surgical procedures, or experimental therapies.
Free-text field for participants to specify an "other" response about their menstruation status or type when none of the listed options apply.
Indicates whether the participant currently has any other neurological condition(s); responses are typically Yes/No, with space to list the specific condition(s) if Yes.
Free-text field where participants specify any other neurological condition(s) they currently have (responses recorded as text).
Free-text description of any other treatments received for a neurological condition (e.g., medications, physical/occupational therapies, procedures/surgeries).
Free-text description of any additional treatment(s) the participant is currently receiving for neurological condition(s), e.g., medications, therapies, or procedures.
Free-text field to list any other speech-related condition(s) not captured elsewhere (for example, stuttering, dysarthria, apraxia).
Free-text field where the participant or clinician specifies any other speech condition(s) not listed elsewhere (e.g., apraxia, dysarthria).
Free-text description of any other surgical treatment(s) received for ear, nose, mouth, throat, or speech conditions, listing the procedure name(s) and relevant details.

Indicates whether the participant has had any other surgical treatment for an ear, nose, mouth, throat, or speech-related condition (response: yes/no), with an optional free-text field to describe the procedure.
Free-text entry describing any other throat condition not captured elsewhere (briefly name the condition and relevant details), left blank if none.
Free-text field where participants specify any other current throat condition(s) not captured by the listed options (e.g., tonsillitis, laryngitis, vocal cord nodules).

Specify any other cancer treatments the participant is currently receiving, naming each treatment type (e.g., chemotherapy, radiation, immunotherapy, targeted therapy, hormonal therapy, surgery, or clinical trial medications).
Free-text description provided by the participant of any other treatment received for a psychological condition that is not captured in the listed treatment options.

Free-text field for specifying any additional treatments the participant is currently receiving for psychological conditions (for example, psychotherapy, counseling, group therapy, or complementary/alternative therapies).
Free-text field to specify any other job or hobby that requires using your voice loudly for many hours per day (e.g., teacher, coach, singer).
Names of any pain-relief medications the participant is taking, including dose (e.g., mg) and dosing frequency when provided.
Whether the participant takes painkillers (e.g., opioid analgesics such as Vicodin); typically recorded as Yes/No.
Indicates whether the participant has a clinical diagnosis of panic disorder, recorded as yes/no/unknown.
Indicates whether the participant has a clinician-diagnosed Parkinson's disease (response options: Yes/No).
Self-reported difficulty concentrating on a task for ten minutes, recorded as a Likert-style frequency/severity response (e.g., not at all to nearly every day).
Participant's usual day-to-day work or occupation, provided as a free-text description (e.g., job title and primary duties).
Participant’s self-reported level of difficulty or discomfort when interacting with unfamiliar people, recorded on an ordinal scale (e.g., none, mild, moderate, severe).
Participant-reported ability to maintain friendships, typically recorded as a categorical or Likert response indicating degree of difficulty (e.g., none/mild/moderate/severe).
Indicates whether the participant can get dressed independently or requires assistance, typically recorded as independent, needs assistance, or dependent.
Degree to which the participant has been emotionally affected by their health problems, reported on a Likert scale ranging from "Not at all" to "Extremely."
Self-reported difficulty learning a new task (e.g., learning to navigate to a new place), recorded as a severity rating (e.g., none to severe).
Participant-reported degree of difficulty joining community activities (e.g., festivities or religious events) compared with others, recorded on an ordinal scale (e.g., no problem to severe problem).
Indicates whether the participant can stand for long periods (about 30 minutes), typically recorded as a Yes/No response or a rating of difficulty.
Self-reported level of difficulty or interference in taking care of household responsibilities, recorded on an ordered response scale (e.g., none/minimal to extreme/complete).
Self-reported ability to walk a long distance (about 1 kilometer or equivalent), typically recorded as no difficulty, some difficulty, or unable to perform.
Indicates whether the participant is able to wash their whole body independently (response: yes/no).
Number of days in the past 30 days (integer, 0–30) during which the participant was completely unable to carry out their usual activities or work because of any health condition.
Number of days in the past 30 days (excluding days the person was completely unable) that the participant cut back or reduced their usual activities or work due to any health condition; integer 0–30.
Number of days in the past 30 days that physical health difficulties were present, recorded as an integer value from 0 to 30 days.
Indicates whether the participant has a pneumothorax or atelectasis (collapsed lung), recorded as present or absent (yes/no).
Indicates whether the participant was endotracheally intubated for more than 7 days (yes/no).
Free-text description of any additional psychological condition not covered by the predefined response options.

Free-text field for specifying any additional psychological condition(s) not listed elsewhere, entered as short text describing the diagnosis or condition (e.g., "seasonal affective disorder", "adjustment disorder").
Indicates whether the participant is taking psychotropic/antipsychotic medications, with medication names and, when available, dose and frequency (e.g., drug name and mg/day).
Indicates whether the participant has a current or past diagnosis of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), recorded as yes or no.
Whether the participant has a diagnosis of pulmonary hypertension (response options typically: yes, no, or unknown/missing).
Indicates whether the participant received radiation therapy (yes/no), with any available details such as treatment site, dates, or dose (commonly reported in Gray).
Indicates whether the participant has ever received radiation therapy to the head or neck (Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant has ever received radiation therapy to the chest (thoracic radiation); responses are typically Yes, No, or Unknown.

Indicates whether the participant has received radioactive iodine therapy (commonly for thyroid disease); typically recorded as yes/no and, when available, may include treatment date and dose (e.g., millicuries [mCi] or becquerels [Bq]).
Self-rated ability to read aloud in English or Spanish—reading at a normal pace accurately and with understanding—reported on a Likert-style scale (e.g., poor to excellent).

Number of times in the past year the participant used a recreational substance or medication (e.g., methamphetamine, cannabis, inhalants, tranquilizers, barbiturates, cocaine, ecstasy, hallucinogens, or narcotics) in doses or for reasons other than prescribed, reported as a count per year (responses may include "More than one").
Indicates whether the participant has a history of recurrent bronchitis (repeated episodes of bronchial inflammation), recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Medications taken to treat acid reflux/gastroesophageal reflux disease (e.g., proton‑pump inhibitors, H2 blockers, antacids), recorded as medication names with dose (e.g., mg) and dosing frequency.
Indicates whether the participant has ever attended rehabilitation or counseling for heavy substance use (response: Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant has a current or past diagnosis of schizophrenia, recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant has been diagnosed with scoliosis (a curvature of the spine), recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant currently has a scratchy or sore throat (yes/no).
Self-reported indication of whether the participant currently has seasonal allergies, cold-like symptoms, or other conditions that may affect their voice today (yes/no).
Indicates whether the participant has a history of seasonal allergies (e.g., hay fever or pollen allergy), recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Indicates whether the participant uses sedatives or tranquilizers (e.g., sleeping pills or Valium), recorded as a Yes/No response.
Indicates whether the participant is currently experiencing shortness of breath (dyspnea), recorded as a yes/no response.
Indicates whether the participant has a diagnosis of sinus (nasal cavity or paranasal) cancer, typically recorded as Yes, No, or Unknown.
Whether the participant has undergone sinus surgery (recorded as Yes/No; may include procedure type or date if available).
Indicates whether the participant reports having or being diagnosed with sinusitis (rhinitis), typically recorded as a Yes/No response.
Indicates whether the participant has a clinical diagnosis of Sjögren's syndrome (response options: Yes, No, Unknown).

Indicates whether the participant reports sleep disturbance (e.g., difficulty falling or staying asleep or poor-quality/nonrestorative sleep), typically recorded as yes/no or as a categorical severity or frequency rating.
Whether the participant has had surgical treatment for a sleep disorder (e.g., implantation of a device for sleep apnea); recorded as Yes/No with optional procedure details.

Self-reported frequency of smoking marijuana (cannabis) in the past three months, including recreational or prescribed use, recorded as categorical frequency (e.g., never, once/twice, monthly, weekly, daily).
Age in years when the participant began smoking cigarettes regularly (numeric).
Participant-reported age in years at which they completely stopped smoking cigarettes (numeric).
Self-reported frequency of marijuana (cannabis, pot, hash, etc.) use during the past three months, recorded as categorical frequency (e.g., never, monthly, weekly, daily).
Indicates whether the participant reports difficulty speaking, typically recorded as yes/no or as a categorical severity (e.g., none, mild, moderate, severe).
Indicates whether the participant is currently receiving therapy for speech, voice, or swallowing (response: yes/no; if yes, may include therapy type and frequency).
Participant's age in years when they first began regularly using nicotine products (numeric value reported in years).

Indicates whether the participant is currently taking stimulant medications (e.g., Ritalin, Adderall), typically recorded as yes/no or with medication name, dose (mg), and timing relative to assessment.
Indicates whether the participant is currently taking stimulant medications (e.g., methylphenidate, amphetamines); if yes, list medication name(s), dose(s) (mg) and dosing frequency.
Approximate age in years when the participant completely stopped using nicotine products (numeric, in years; leave blank if never stopped or still currently using).
Indicates whether the participant has a history of stroke and/or clinical aphasia, recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant exhibits stuttering or other speech dysfluency, typically recorded as a categorical response (e.g., yes/no or a severity/type label if available).
Indicates whether the participant was receiving supplemental oxygen at the time of assessment (yes/no); when provided, includes delivery method and flow rate in liters per minute.
Indicates whether the participant has a history of surgical procedures (yes/no); when applicable, record the procedure type and date (YYYY-MM-DD).
Indicates whether the participant has a swallowing disorder (dysphagia), recorded as present/absent (yes/no).
Indicates whether the participant has received talk therapy from a mental health professional (e.g., social worker, psychologist, or psychiatrist); responses are Yes or No.
Introductory prompt instructing participants to report current and past medical conditions that could have long-term effects on their voice.
Indicates whether the participant has ever been diagnosed with thyroid cancer (Yes/No).

Whether the participant has a diagnosed thyroid condition (e.g., thyroid polyp, Hashimoto’s, Graves’ disease, hypothyroidism, hyperthyroidism); typically recorded as Yes/No, with the specific condition noted if applicable.
Indicates whether the participant is currently taking thyroid hormone replacement medication (e.g., levothyroxine); responses are typically Yes/No.
Participant’s current average number of nicotine uses per day, recorded as a numeric value (times/day).
Self-reported current level of tiredness on a 0–10 numeric scale, where 0 = not tired at all and 10 = extremely tired.
Types of caffeinated products consumed today (e.g., coffee, tea, soda, energy drinks, chocolate, caffeinated medications), with multiple selections allowed.
Free-text field where participants specify any other substances or items they consumed today that were not listed among the provided response options.
Indicates whether the participant consumed coffee or any other caffeinated products today (Yes/No), including items such as coffee, tea, soda, or energy drinks.
Indicates whether the participant has ever had a tonsillectomy (surgical removal of the tonsils), with or without adenoidectomy, typically recorded as Yes/No.
Indicates whether the participant currently has a tracheostomy tube (recorded as yes/no for presence vs. absence).
Whether the participant has a history of traumatic brain injury (TBI), typically recorded as "Yes" or "No" and, when available, accompanied by severity and date of injury.
Whether the participant has a current or past diagnosis of tuberculosis, recorded as "Yes", "No", or "Unknown".
Indicates which types of caffeinated products a participant typically consumes (e.g., coffee, tea, soda, energy drinks, chocolate, none, other).
Free-text field where participants describe any "Other" food, drink, or substance they consume on a typical day that was not listed among the predefined options.
Indicates whether the participant typically consumes coffee or other caffeinated products on a usual day (e.g., tea, energy drinks, soda, caffeine pills); responses: Yes/No.
Unit of measurement for the associated confounder value (for example: "kg", "cm", "m", "lb", "s", "min", or "years").
Indicates whether the participant has ever used marijuana, cocaine or crack, or other (non-prescribed) drugs (lifetime use), recorded as Yes/No.
Whether the participant has used any nicotine products (e.g., cigarettes, e‑cigarettes, chewing tobacco) at least 100 times in their lifetime (Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant has ever (lifetime) used prescription medications on their own without a doctor's prescription or in larger amounts or for longer than prescribed (Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant currently has a vagal nerve stimulator device (Yes/No).
Indicates whether velopharyngeal insufficiency (problems with closing the soft palate causing hyponasality, nasal air emission, etc.) is present, recorded as present/absent/unknown.
Whether the participant has vocal cord dysfunction (paradoxical vocal fold motion), i.e., a diagnosis or self‑report of the condition, recorded as yes/no/unknown.
Indicates whether the participant has a vocal fold hemorrhage (bleeding of the vocal cords), typically recorded as yes/no (with options for unknown or not assessed).
Which jobs or hobbies require the participant to use their voice for many hours a day (multiple selections allowed), e.g., teacher, singer, actor, coach, clergy, or call‑center worker.
Participant's body weight at the time of assessment, recorded as a numeric value in kilograms (kg).
Total number of years the participant has used nicotine, recorded as a numeric value in years (0 if never used).
Indicates whether the participant has a tobacco cigarette smoking history of at least 10 pack‑years (response: Yes/No).
Highest absolute eosinophil count measured in the past 12 months, reported as a numeric value in cells per microliter (µL).
Total Asthma Control Test (ACT) score from the most recent visit (numeric, range 5–25, with higher scores indicating better asthma control).

Whether the participant has a history of confirmed expiratory airflow variability (Yes/No), defined as an increase in FEV1 or FVC of ≥200 mL and ≥12% from baseline after bronchodilator or after ≥4 weeks of inhaled corticosteroid therapy, or a positive bronchial challenge test.
Indicates whether the participant has a specific asthma subtype (Yes/No).

Indicates whether the clinician assessed the clinical probability of asthma as high (e.g., allergic or eosinophilic phenotype with variable symptoms such as wheeze, cough, chest tightness, or dyspnea); typically recorded as Yes/No/Unknown.
Asthma subtype(s) reported for the participant—select all that apply (e.g., allergic, non‑allergic, exercise‑induced, occupational).
Free-text field for specifying the asthma subtype when "Other" was chosen (e.g., occupational asthma, exercise-induced asthma).
Indicates whether spirometry shows the FEV1/FVC ratio is below the 5th percentile or has a z‑score ≤ −1.65 (Yes/No).
Whether the participant’s forced vital capacity (FVC) meets the abnormal threshold — i.e., FVC value < 0.7 (as recorded) or FVC z‑score ≤ -1.65 — recorded as Yes/No.
Total COPD Assessment Test (CAT) score: the 8‑item questionnaire total (0–40 points), with higher scores indicating greater respiratory symptom burden and worse health status.
Indicates whether the participant has a chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) subtype (Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant has COPD, asthma, both conditions, or neither (responses: COPD, asthma, both, none).
COPD subtype(s) reported for the participant; multiple selections allowed (e.g., chronic bronchitis, emphysema, alpha‑1 antitrypsin deficiency, other).
Indicates whether the participant currently smokes tobacco (e.g., cigarettes) with responses typically recorded as Yes or No.
Indicates whether the participant has a strong history of environmental allergies (e.g., pollen, dust, mold, or pet dander); typically recorded as yes or no.
Fractional exhaled nitric oxide (FeNO), a biomarker of airway inflammation, recorded as a numeric value in parts per billion (ppb).
Indicates whether the participant has a recorded fractional exhaled nitric oxide (FeNO) measurement within the past 12 months (Yes/No); FeNO is typically reported in parts per billion (ppb).
Participant's FEV1 (forced expiratory volume in one second) expressed as percent of the predicted value, reported as a percentage (if known).
Clinical GOLD Group: the COPD classification reflecting symptom burden and exacerbation risk, recorded as A, B, or E (E indicates high exacerbation risk).
Indicates the participant’s inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) dose category, recorded as low, medium, or high.

Modified Medical Research Council (mMRC) dyspnea grade (integer 0–4) indicating breathlessness severity, where 0 = only breathless with strenuous exercise and 4 = too breathless to leave the house or breathless when dressing.
Count of moderate exacerbations in the past 12 months—defined as episodes requiring a course of oral corticosteroids (OCS)—recorded as an integer number of exacerbations.
Pulmonary function test (PFT) report (e.g., spirometry) for COPD/asthma diagnosis containing measurements such as FEV1 and FVC, typically reported in liters and as percent predicted.
Indicates whether the participant underwent a full pulmonary function test (PFT) that included lung volume measurements (Yes/No).
Indicates whether the participant has undergone a pulmonary function test (PFT) within the past 6 months (Yes/No).

Participant's current pharmacologic treatments for COPD or asthma (select all that apply), with options such as inhaled short‑acting beta‑agonist (SABA), long‑acting beta‑agonist (LABA), inhaled corticosteroid (ICS), oral corticosteroid, leukotriene modifier, anticholinergic/long‑acting muscarinic antagonist (LAMA), combination inhaler, biologic therapy, systemic immunosuppressant, none, or other (specify).
Lists which pulmonary symptoms the participant reports (e.g., cough, wheeze, shortness of breath), with multiple symptoms allowed to be selected.
Indicates whether the participant met bronchodilator responsiveness criteria—defined as an increase in FEV1 or FVC of ≥200 mL and ≥12% from baseline after bronchodilator administration (Yes/No).
Whether the participant shows a restrictive ventilatory defect, defined as total lung capacity (TLC) below the 5th percentile or a TLC z‑score ≤ −1.65 (yes/no/unknown).
Count of severe exacerbations requiring hospitalization in the past 12 months (integer count; 0 = none).
Indicates whether the participant has any other significant inhalation exposures (e.g., occupational or environmental), recorded as Yes/No with details provided if Yes.

Free-text description of any significant inhalation exposures relevant to COPD or asthma (e.g., occupational dusts, chemical fumes, biomass or tobacco smoke), including exposure type, timing, and duration where known.
Free-text field to specify other significant inhalation exposures (for example, biomass smoke, occupational dusts, chemical fumes, or secondhand smoke) not captured by the listed exposure options.
Indicates whether spirometry demonstrated clinical evidence of airway obstruction (responses: Yes, No, or Unknown/not performed).
Whether the participant has ever undergone a spirometry test (response: Yes/No).

Specifies which verification standard was used to validate the spirometry test, with response options including "ATS/ERS" or the alternative verification method (choose "ATS/ERS" if both are available).
Participant-reported COPD-related diagnoses—select all that apply (checkboxes), for example COPD, emphysema, chronic bronchitis, or none.
Indicates whether the participant appears agitated (restless, fidgety, pacing, or unable to sit still), typically recorded as present/absent or on the study’s affect severity scale.

Indicates whether the child has a history of a neck mass, with multiple selectable options to specify type or cause (e.g., congenital cyst, enlarged lymph node, tumor) or responses such as none/unknown.

Date of the surgical procedure to remove a branchial cleft cyst (neck mass), recorded as a date in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Indicates whether the participant has undergone surgery to treat a neck mass or dermoid cyst (Yes/No).
Date (YYYY-MM-DD) of the surgical procedure to excise the neck mass diagnosed as a dermoid cyst.
Indicates whether the child has ever undergone surgery to remove or treat a neck mass or enlarged lymph node (responses: Yes/No/Unknown).
Date of the surgery to treat or remove the neck mass/enlarged lymph node, recorded as a calendar date (YYYY-MM-DD).
Indicates whether the participant has ever had surgery to remove or treat a neck mass, thyroid nodule, or related cancer (response options: Yes/No/Unknown).
Date when the participant underwent surgery for a neck mass, thyroid nodule, or thyroid cancer, recorded as a calendar date (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD).
Free-text description of any neck mass condition not covered by the predefined options, entered as a brief, plain-language note.
Whether the participant has ever had surgery to treat a thyroglossal duct cyst (a congenital neck mass), recorded as Yes or No.
Date of the surgical procedure to remove or treat a thyroglossal duct cyst (enter as a calendar date, e.g., YYYY-MM-DD).
Indicates whether the child has a history of neurological disorders (e.g., cerebral palsy, muscular dystrophy), recorded as Yes/No with an option to specify diagnosis details if present.
Free-text field to list the participant’s pediatric neurological disorder(s) (text entry), for example epilepsy, cerebral palsy, or other diagnosed neurological conditions.
Whether the child has ever had neurological or orthopedic surgery that could affect breathing or speech (response: Yes/No).
Free-text field recording the name and brief details of the surgical or medical procedure performed.
The calendar date when the surgical procedure occurred, recorded in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).
Whether the child has ever required respiratory support, including supplemental oxygen, endotracheal intubation, mechanical ventilation, or a tracheostomy (Yes/No).
If applicable, free-text description of the participant’s oxygen support, including device type (e.g., nasal cannula, CPAP) and any parameters such as flow rate (L/min) or oxygen concentration (%).
Multiple-selection checklist of psychological or mood disorders the child has a history of (e.g., anxiety, depression, ADHD, bipolar disorder, autism spectrum disorder, other).
Free-text field to specify any pediatric psychiatric disorder(s) not listed among the standard response options (enter the condition name(s)).
Whether the child has ever been diagnosed with gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) or has ever taken medication for acid reflux (response: Yes/No).
Free-text field to specify details about the participant's reflux condition (e.g., type of reflux, diagnosis, treatments or medications, age at onset, and severity).
Unique alphanumeric identifier for the participant session (study visit) used to link and distinguish session-specific records.
Indicates whether the child has a history of snoring and/or obstructive sleep apnea, with multiple selections allowed (e.g., snoring, obstructive sleep apnea, or none).
Obstructive apnea–hypopnea index (oAHI) from the participant's sleep study, reported as the number of obstructive apneas and hypopneas per hour (events/hour).
Date and time when the pediatric medical conditions questionnaire was started, recorded as an ISO 8601 datetime (e.g., YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss, with timezone if available).
Whether the child has ever experienced noisy breathing (stridor) or episodes of difficulty breathing, recorded as Yes or No.
If stridor is present, a free-text description of the child's stridor including characteristics such as onset, severity, timing (inspiratory/expiratory/biphasic), and any suspected cause.
Indicates whether the child has ever undergone surgery on the throat, vocal cords, or airway (response: Yes/No).
Free-text field to specify details of the pediatric surgery (e.g., procedure name and any relevant details such as date, laterality, or complications).
Whether the participant has ever had a tonsillectomy (surgical removal of the tonsils), typically recorded as Yes or No.
Date of the participant's tonsillectomy surgery, recorded as a calendar date in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Indicates whether the child has ever been diagnosed with a voice disorder or speech delay (response options typically: Yes, No, or Unknown/Unsure).
Free-text field to enter the specific pediatric medical condition when "Other"/"Please specify" is selected in the medical conditions list.
Caregiver-reported history of the child’s voice disorders, allowing multiple selections of applicable types (e.g., hoarseness, vocal nodules, laryngitis, spasmodic dysphonia, or "none").
Total time in seconds required to complete the pediatric PHQA questionnaire, measured as the elapsed time from start to finish.

Self-reported frequency over the past two weeks of feeling bad about yourself (e.g., feeling like a failure or letting yourself or your family down), rated on a 4-point scale: 0=Not at all, 1=Several days, 2=More than half the days, 3=Nearly every day.

Participant-reported frequency of feeling down, depressed, irritable, or hopeless over the past two weeks, recorded on a 4‑point scale: Not at all; Several days; More than half the days; Nearly every day.

Participant-reported frequency over the past two weeks of noticeable psychomotor changes (moving or speaking very slowly, or being unusually fidgety/restless), recorded on the PHQ-A frequency scale (e.g., Not at all to Nearly every day).

How often the youth experienced poor appetite, weight loss, or overeating in the past two weeks, recorded on an ordinal frequency scale (e.g., not at all; several days; more than half the days; nearly every day).
Self-reported frequency in the past two weeks of feeling tired or having little energy, rated "Not at all," "Several days," "More than half the days," or "Nearly every day."
Participant-reported frequency of having little interest or pleasure in doing things over the past two weeks, rated 0–3 (0=Not at all, 1=Several days, 2=More than half the days, 3=Nearly every day).
Unique alphanumeric identifier for the pediatric PHQA assessment session used to link data collected during the same session across files.
Date and time when the Pediatric PHQ‑A questionnaire was started, recorded as a timestamp (ISO 8601 date/time).
